thread.title: Falae, Kidnapped Former Presidential Candidate, Released
thread.title_full: Falae, Kidnapped Former Presidential Candidate, Released

author: Secure Nigeria 365
title: Falae, Kidnapped Former Presidential Candidate, Released
text:
tweet 
A family source told SaharaReporters that Falae was dropped off in Owo town following intense negotiations with his abductors. Olu Falae, a former Secretary to the federal government and one-time presidential candidate of the Action Congress who was kidnapped a few days ago, has been released by his abductors. 
Chief Falae was kidnapped on his 77th birthday at his farm near Akure in Ondo State by unknown gunmen who shot at a pickup truck which was conveying him to the property. 
A family source told SaharaReporters that Falae was dropped off in Owo town following intense negotiations with his abductors. 
Eni Akinsola, a media aide to Gov. Olusegun Mimiko, confirmed his release to SaharaReporters. He declined to reveal how much was paid as ransom to the kidnappers, telling our reporter to direct such questions to Nigeriaâ€™s security agencies.
